review_content: Bijna helder geel bier met een kleine witte schuimkraag met gemiddelde structuur die snel inzakt. De sterke geur van citrus komt je al bij het inschenken tegemoet. Fris bier met wederom de citrus maar verder vrij vlak.
Slightly hazy citrus gold. Thin head with medium retention. Aroma intensity 3.75/5. Citrus (lemon) aroma, notes of pine. Medium to heavy bitter, slightly salty. Light body

355ml bottle. Pours clear canary blonde, with fine white foam. Aroma is delicate hoppy and citrus.Body is slightly thin, with average carbonation. Taste is very moderately bitter, with some grainy sweet base behind. Final is thin

Nergens spannend maar een standaard zomerse IPA met een laag alcohol percentage om je dorst te lessen. Licht citrus fruitige hoppige smaak. Beetje droog met een redelijk bitter. Moutige vlakke geur. Kraak helder gele IPA met kleine schuimkraag. Proefglas
Un vrai régal. L’amertume est bien présente mais ce n’est que mieux. Parfaite !
Super light beer. Not much for hop aroma. Brewed here in the Netherlands. Fresh. But like a watered down sessiom ipa. However it is super clean as expected. Albert heijn Amsterdam
33 CL. Aroma floral e malte. Sabor a maracujá. Final seco. Corpo ligeiro. Carbono médio.
Esta é uma cerveja boa cor, suave, pouco amarga (comparando com a indian pale ale) e leve.
Clear golden pour with thin head. Crisp, light and clean. Not much flavour to it, but drinkable

Robe jaune clair, bière légère portée sur les agrumes, surtout le citron, l'orange et le pamplemousse, avec des notes florales. Très légère amertume.
Assez classique dans le style Session IPA, mais fait parfaitement le job après une belle journée ensoleillée, bien rafraichissante !
Alone at home. Pale yelllow colored beer with small white head and only few carbonation. Hopped floral aroma. Full sparkling palate palate. Finish is hopped sweet bitter spiced. Nice refreshing beer.
Bouteille 33cl couleur blonde dorée un peu sombre, goût sur le fruit de la passion, très douce, pas de sucre, pêche, facile à boire

Bottle, 330. Pours yellowish with a short foamy head. Body is light, with moderate carbonation and slightly thick mouth feel. Taste is tarte, mildly bitter with low sweetness. Flavors of lemon, lemon peel, pith, grapefruit, vanilla, yeast fermentation, mellow esters, herbal-piney. Too acidic for me, flavors are a bit flat.

Une session IPA trouve en déstockage chez Noz. Une robe dorée, pas de mousse et du coup pas très engageante. Un nez fruité très sympathique, en bouche c'est pareil par contre la longueur n'est pas là mais en même temps on n'est que sur du 4°, ça a certainement un rapport.

Bière 33 cl trouvée chez Noz Douai. Robe blonde dorée limpide, nombreuses fines bulles et mousse blanche peu persistante. Arômes agréables de fruits exotiques, agrumes et céréales douces, légèrement mielleux, plutôt sympa. En bouche, une fraîche et très légère amertume, une faible présence en bouche, carbonatation élevée... Bière de soif mais qui manque de corps et d'amertume. (M)

Bijna helder geel bier met een kleine witte schuimkraag met gemiddelde structuur die snel inzakt. De sterke geur van citrus komt je al bij het inschenken tegemoet. Fris bier met wederom de citrus maar verder vrij vlak.
Slightly hazy citrus gold. Thin head with medium retention. Aroma intensity 3.75/5. Citrus (lemon) aroma, notes of pine. Medium to heavy bitter, slightly salty. Light body

355ml bottle. Pours clear canary blonde, with fine white foam. Aroma is delicate hoppy and citrus.Body is slightly thin, with average carbonation. Taste is very moderately bitter, with some grainy sweet base behind. Final is thin

Nergens spannend maar een standaard zomerse IPA met een laag alcohol percentage om je dorst te lessen. Licht citrus fruitige hoppige smaak. Beetje droog met een redelijk bitter. Moutige vlakke geur. Kraak helder gele IPA met kleine schuimkraag. Proefglas
Un vrai régal. L’amertume est bien présente mais ce n’est que mieux. Parfaite !

33 CL. Aroma floral e malte. Sabor a maracujá. Final seco. Corpo ligeiro. Carbono médio.
Esta é uma cerveja boa cor, suave, pouco amarga (comparando com a indian pale ale) e leve.
Clear golden pour with thin head. Crisp, light and clean. Not much flavour to it, but drinkable

Robe jaune clair, bière légère portée sur les agrumes, surtout le citron, l'orange et le pamplemousse, avec des notes florales. Très légère amertume. Assez classique dans le style Session IPA, mais fait parfaitement le job après une bell…
Alone at home. Pale yelllow colored beer with small white head and only few carbonation. Hopped floral aroma. Full sparkling palate palate. Finish is hopped sweet bitter spiced. Nice refreshing beer.
Bouteille 33cl couleur blonde dorée un peu sombre, goût sur le fruit de la passion, très douce, pas de sucre, pêche, facile à boire

Bottle, 330. Pours yellowish with a short foamy head. Body is light, with moderate carbonation and slightly thick mouth feel. Taste is tarte, mildly bitter with low sweetness. Flavors of lemon, lemon peel, pith, grapefruit, vanilla, yeast fermentation,…

Une session IPA trouve en déstockage chez Noz. Une robe dorée, pas de mousse et du coup pas très engageante. Un nez fruité très sympathique, en bouche c'est pareil par contre la longueur n'est pas là mais en même temps on n'est que sur du 4°, ça a…

Bière 33 cl trouvée chez Noz Douai. Robe blonde dorée limpide, nombreuses fines bulles et mousse blanche peu persistante. Arômes agréables de fruits exotiques, agrumes et céréales douces, légèrement mielleux, plutôt sympa. En bouche, une fraîch…
A nice one for pre dinner with sis and her man and after installing doors and basement windows in the cold and staying thoroughly preoccupied with numbers 1 to 5 and the new ones trickling in.
Super aromat. Mega cytrus, nafta, wyraźny Mosaic. W smaku puszyste, mineralne z lekka goryczka. Pijalne, nieco wodniste, ale generalnie bardzo dobre w stylu.

Session IPA by this now Heineken-owned but ‘classic’ American craft brewery, can from the Albert Heijn supermarket installed in Ghent’s Ghelamco football stadium.  Snow white, thick and mousy, cobweb-lacing, uneven-bubbled head, opening and eventually dissolving completely, over a crystal clear, ‘metallic’ pale golden beer with lively fizz.  Aroma of lemon candy, orange flower water, guava even, sugared lime juice, some toasted onion, touch white pepper, birdseed, minerals, bread crust, vague undertone of groundnut oil.  Clean onset, fruitiness from the hops early on (guava, mandarin), lots of minerally carbonation; smooth, slick cereally and thinly white-bready body, pleasantly bittered by a long grapefruity and peppery hoppiness, adding retronasal citrusiness and faint background hints of cedar oil and toasted onion; sparkling water-like minerality continues, but the finish is given enough body by the hop bitterness.  A session IPA fully placed in the old Californian West Coast IPA idiom, the way it all began years ago – almost feeling old-fashioned in that sense, but I could not care less, in fact I find it very refreshing to encounter one of these old school West Coast IPAs again.  Very enjoyable.
Liquide doré avec mousse quasi inexistante. Nez légèrement acidulé, houblonne et malté. En bouche, c'est exactement pareil et ce côté acidulé prend vraiment le dessus !! C'est plutôt très moyen !!!
33 cl. bottle at home. Low but lasting fluffy white head. Clear pale yellow body. Weak fruity straw aroma. Mildly hopped sweet straw fuity flavor with low carbonation and a short finish.

bottiglia 33 cl, schiuma bianca fine evanescente, colore giallo smorto limpido, al naso è intensa uva mango agrumi, in bocca ananas pompelmo uva frutta tropicale, minerale, corpo scarno, carbonazione forte, amaro moderato. Fresca aromatica dissetante. Molto buona. c. Carrefour Germignaga 10.01.21
Sample bottle, golden beer, small head. Aroma is citrus, hops, light malt. Taste is the same, soap, bitter, lemon. Too much soap flavour.

Light blonde with small foam.
A nose of citra, lemon, grapefruit and resin hops.
Fresh on the palate, with citrus fruit and pine flavors. 
Little bitterness.
Gold im Glas, stabiler Badeschaum. In der Nase hopfig fruchtig, im Trunk Session halt, sehr zurückgenommen, wässrig. Für den durstigen Sommer okay.

Taster. Poured clear golden color with an average frothy white head that lasted with very good lacing. Moderate balanced aroma. Medium body with a dry smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate bittersweet flavor with a moderate bittersweet finish of medium duration. This session beer met my expectations.
Earlier Rating: 11/1/2012 Total Score: 3.7
Draft. Poured a clear amber color with an average creamy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy earthy hop and malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where exceeded.
Found out of can from Ingles in Franklin, North Carolina. Pours a standard yellow with a medium white foam. Light aroma. Light and refreshing flavor. Crushable.
Hele lekkere, lichte session IPA. Hele dunne smaak maar heel fris en fruitig. 4%. Uit Beerwulf Advent pakket. Top product van deze Californische dochter van Heineken!
Good for a light IPA.  Clear and a little watery but the taste is good.  Love 3 carbs and 98 calories.
Un pèl acuosa, però correcta per les pretensions (baix abv i poques calories). Bon nas si es deixa atemperar una mica. Maltosa, amb notes herbals i resinoses.

35,5cl blikje via Albert Heijn, Maastricht 
Alcoholpercentage van 4%
Uitgeschonken in Hopt glas 

Uiterlijk: goudblond met luchtige witte schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: aroma van fruitig, lychee, tropisch, smaak is fruitig, citrus, ananas, lychee, wat dun ook voor een SIPA
Passion fruit with bready malts. Thin bodied bit watery some sourness and a bit of bitterness medium carbonated. A clean dry finish. Overall a bit unbalanced and a bit too watery but ok.

can. Brilliantly clear light gold. White frothy head. Hoppy aroma, citrus fruit, some pine. Biscuit malt. Dry flavor, bready and grainy.  High bitter finish. Hop flavor really dives. Wait let's check the can....I don't get their numbering system so I can't tell how old it is. Watery.  I don't like this.
Sept 2020. Brown bottle, filtered, from BeerWulf.  Low abv lager and lime. Commercial lager with lemony flavours. A bit dirty. Not a great beer, but drinkable. [2.5]

12 oz can rating.  Clear golden pour with a white head.  Pretty non descript and looks like a pale lager.  However, the flavor has some hops and it is refreshing and decent.  Similar to Bells light hearted and reminds me a bit of Surly Bitter Brewer.  Good even though it's light on flavor.  Saves me a bit in the calorie department and ABV.

Bottle at home. Clear very light golden ale, foamy white head. Crisp en clean floral citrus, soapy, grassy, very lightly malted, faintly bitter - nice balance (although there isn't that much taste to be balanced). Light body, lively carbonation.

355ml can from Asda. Pours pale gold, white head, good retention and lacing. Tropical fruit aroma of grapefruit, mango, pineapple, pine combined with malts. Taste is malt combining with the tropical fruit notes being a touch sour, moving then on to pine, mild bitterness and finishing quite dry and a little peppery. Body is a little light but this is a session version, carbonation a touch too high. Overall a very good Session IPA and glad I bought the 4 pack.

Bottle, 33 cl @ Taxa. Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with a thin white head. Sour aroma with a hint of vinegar. Watery taste, moderate bitterness, no aftertaste. Is this a Heineken in disguise? I tasted low alcohol beers better than this one. Really boring and dull beer.

Pours a very light and clear color with a good head but it dissipates quite quickly. Aroma is pretty big for a light beer, notes of citrus fruits like mango, orange, grapefruit, and lemon, followed by fresh grass and some malt. Taste is mild, less fruity and more into lemon and grapefruit with a very good amount of bitter hop to liven up a lighter backbone of malt. Super impressive for a light beer, one of my favorites of the style.

Blonde claire, petite mousse.
Nez sur les houblons genre citra, citron, pamplemousse, résine.
Bouche fraîche, aux goûts de fruits 'agrume' et de pin. Peu de corps, assez rèche au palais avec une petite amertume. Plutôt banale !

Bottle from Albert Heijn in Gorinchem, The Netherlands. 
The beer is clear yellow colored with a small white foam, little unstable also. Carbonation is average. 
The aroma is malts, wheat, grass, flowers, tropical fruits, citrus and spices. 
The taste is light bodied and fruity, but also light sweet, with grainy notes like wheat. It goes to pleasantly bitter with hops from the aroma. 
The finish is refreshing, dry and nice bitter.
Bottle. Hazy pale golden color with a minimal head. Aroma of fruity hops and mandarin. Some bitterness. Thin body.

Bottle from Albert Heijn. Pours clear yellow with a big, lasting, frothy, white head. Aroma of mango, pineapple, pear, pine, wheat, lemon zest. Taste has sweetish pineapple, apple & pear, sour wheaty & zesty profile with subtle bitter pine & herbs underneath. Dry, piney hoppy finish, bready malty but grapefruity-citrussy zest & yeast keep the prominent position. Medium body, slick texture, fizzy carbonation. Very basic Session Ale but it has its own recognizable citrus feat.

Bouquet fruité, citronné, légèreté en bouche, Amertume bien maîtrisée.
Pas trop alcooleuse. Légère. 
Jolie bonne surprise.

12 oz can from Total Wine and More in Short Pump, VA  The ale poured a clear yellow color with a fluffy white head a lacing.  Some head retention.  The aroma of lemons is noted. The taste was of more lemons with pale malts. This is a lighter version of most IPAs.  It may appeal to those ale drinkers of a light beer.  The hop selection does offer some nice hop bitterness after each swallow.  The ale has a light body and average carbonation.

Bottle 35,5cl. @home poured into a shaker. Clear pale golden colour, small fizzy white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing. Aroma pale malt, lemon, grapefruit, some pine resin. Taste light sweet and medium bitter, malty, grain, lemon, grapefruit. Light to medium body, watery to oily texture, soft carbonation, dry bittersweet aftertaste, orange pith, mineral notes, nice session ipa.

Bottle. Color: Clear yellow golden, white head. Aroma: Tropical fruit, hop. Taste: Hoppy, tropical fruit, citrus, some lemon. Refrehing. Bit thin body. Ovet moderate bitterness, light sweetness. Subtle malty background. Ok.
Bottle. Golden, clear, whitish foam. Aroma: a bit sweet, citrus, fruity, pear, floral. Taste: clean, watery, light citrus and fruit, drinkable.
SKÅL, CHEERS, SALUT, KIPPIS, YAMAS, L’CHAIM, PROOST,  SALUTE, KANPAI 🍻🙏😎

35.5cl can at home. Appearance: clear pale straw with a medium sized white head. Aroma: fruity, passion fruit, mango and pineapple, some orange too. Taste: low sweetness and pretty high bitterness. Notes of malts, cardboard, passion fruit and pineapple, and some cardboard Palate: light bodied, watery texture, lively carbonation and pretty dry-bitter finish. Overall: quite a good and fruity thirst quencher. As always for session IPAs, the body is weak, but at least the taste isn't so sweet as some other session IPAs.
Bottle. Blonde. Lemon sweets and a hint of grass in the aroma. Dry, Thin. Lemon and soft grassy floral notes in the flavor.
This beer looked great. Puffy white head. Nice birght color. Nice bitter flavors. Lacked carbonation though.
Fles 35,5cl thuis. Grapefruit, citrus, tropisch fruit, fruitig zoetig, malten, grassig, wat harsig. Klein beetje dun. (5-4-2020).

33 cl bottle, served in a Teku glass. Poured clear golden yellow with small half finger off white head. Minimum carbonation. Aroma: Pine, grassy hops, caramel, grapefruit, vanilla, orange peel, pineapple. Taste: Pine, Orange, lemon, caramel, vanilla, hops, citrus, pineapple, grapefruit, pear, green apples, freshly cut grass. Medium body with grassy bittersweet finish. Nice...

Very clear and light yellow. Low on carbon, almost no head.
It's kind of a light weight Little Sumpin'.

home. 35.5 cl bottle. BB 30012021. A thin white foam layer on a clear beer with a light yellow colour. Aroma is very light malty, much more citrus-like hop bitter. Okay. Grapefruit, orange and little tropical. Taste is less malty (body is thin), but a fast upcoming hop bitter, which became dry. Nice fresh fruity taste of lemon, grapefruit and orange.

Pours yellow with a fine white head, thin. Aroma of lemongrass and cedar resin. Taste has grape must, woody, thin malt base. Palate has light citrus, continuation of the cedar on the nose. Good, very full for such a light beer.
bij mij thuis een goud blond kleurig lichaam met een witte kop en met een bloemig citrus hop aroma een gist citrus fruitig zoet hop bitter smaak met een bitter einde

Flasche 0,355l: Helles Gold, klar, mäßig stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; sehr frische + sehr fruchtige Nase, kräftige frische Hopfenaromen, Zitrusnoten, exotische Früchte, Maracuja, Grapefruit, leichte Hefearomen, Malz, Getreide, leichte Würze, etwas Pinie; frischer + fruchtiger Körper, kräftige Hopfennoten, fruchtig-trockene Säure, kräftige Zitrusnoten, Grapefruit, Grapefruitzest, Malz, Getreide, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, leichte Hefearomen, deutlich Pinie; angenehmer fruchtig-trockener Nachgang

35,5 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Albert Heijn, Culemborg.
Very pale yellow with a white head. Light citrus aroma with some grains. Light bitter taste with a light bitter finish. Very thin body. Not offensive at all but a tad boring.

Bouteille de 33 CL achetée chez Super U. Robe dorée pâle quasi limpide. Arômes de citron et agrumes. Texture crémeuse, carbonatation moyenne, légère, faible amertume. Notes herbacées, citron et agrume. Finale sèche et citronnée.

Thuis uit een flesje. Bleek van kleur, niet fraai. Weinig schuim. Een goede hopgeur. Ook mooie bitterheid, hop en wat citrus in de smaak. Zeker voor zomerdagen een fraaie dorstlesser, ook gezien het abv.
Can. Yellow golden pour. Aroma of citrus, white grape, bready malt, orange and pineapple. Taste has citrus, white grape, pineapple, watery bready malt and herbal hop. Bit too thin and watery.

Aroma : Light sweet caramel malt, good dose af grapefruit citrus & a little splash of pineapple. Aroma is only slightly short of a big hoppy West Coast IPA.  Taste : Light citric bitterness, extremely thin with an exceptionally short finish. For the low ABV it's o.k. & fine for a workday lunchtime. Wouldn't make an evening session of it though

335 ml bottle. Pours clear straw with medium head. A: jackfruit or other tropical fruits T: thin/medium body, medium/higher carbonation, sweet malty in the background at the beginning then citrusy, bitter, refreshing,

can.  Poured very light yellow with a white top. Aroma is citrusy. Light bodied, crisp carbonation, refreshing mouthfeel with a lingering bitter finish. Flavour is grainy and light with notes of lemon peel and herbal hops and high bitterness.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Halmgul klar vätska med tjock skum. Dofter av grape, ananas och lite gräs. Menlös smak där främst citrusbeska återfinns. Obefintlig kropp och avsaknad av eftersmak.
Une IPA très..  trop légère ! Mais le goût et le rafraîchissement sont bien  la !

Dzięki Krzysztof. 
Wygląd: Barwa słomkowa, klarowna. Piana biała, średniej wysokości, zbudowana z średnich i drobnych oczek, opada do ostatniej warstwy pozostawiając lacing. 
Aromat: Średnio lotny, choć jak na session IPA jest ok. Na pierwszy plan wysuwają się cytrusy w postaci pomelo, pomarańczy, grejpfruta na średnim poziomie, uzupełnione średnioniskimi owocami tropikalnymi, mango, melona, trochę liczi oraz żywicą i słodowością chlebową na tym samym poziomie z subtelną nutą toffi i miodu.
Smak: Podobnie jak w aromacie z intensywniejszą żywicą dorównującą cytrusom oraz lekką podbudową słodową, tym razem stricte chlebową. W ustach wytrawne, treściwość niska, lekko wodnista, wysycenie niskie. Goryczka średnioniska, żywiczna, krótka i przyjemna. Finisz wytrawny z nutą żywicznej goryczki. 
Ogólnie bardzo pijalne, w smaku trochę przypomina wodę nachmieloną, jednak występuje lekka podbudowa słodowa.

Bottle; supermarket in Copenhagen. 

Pale, light yellow color (~1 SRM/1.97 EBC), pretty clear for a SIPA. Very limited, rapidly diminishing head. Light bodied, average  carbonation, numerous streams of bubbles. Nose is lemon peel and tropical fruits - pineapple and passion fruit.

Immediate zesty lemon flavor kick, slight hoppy bitterness as it warms, then a nearly undetectably brief bitter-sweet malt finish.

From what I gathered online, there exists a version with 4.65% ABV and 54 IBU. That, I think, sounds preferable - even though SIPAs are classically lighter beers.

Gylden klar skum hvid tæt lang 
Citrus salt metal korn 
Bitter modrate 
Vandede livlig 
&home
Clear golden appearance. Aroma is citrus, grassy and hops. Flavour is citrus, slightly bitter, grassy, lemon, malt and floral.

This is a backlog rating from 2014 from a bottle, from notes. When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time, work and/or family. Words to describe this beer are pale malts, grass, citrus, floral, herbal, thin.
A refreshing light but tasty beer. Excellent choice for having a session on a hot day.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Aromat estrowy grejfrutowy gruszkowy limonkowy ale delikatny. malo ciala ale nie wodniste srednia goryczka. Fajnie orzezwia
Very refreshing, quite subtle taste, would prefer slightly more hoppiness but ideal for an end of day can
Pours a pale colour. Taste is quite hoppy and dry. Stronv but sessionable. Nice beer

Bottle thx to dantomlinson 2019-12-14 Göteborg 
AR: dried tropical fruity, grapefruit, citrus zest
AP: pale hazy coppery, wee thin white head
F:  dried tropical fruity, grapefruit, citrus zest, fairly bitter, dry

Bit of a smell of fenugreek along with more normal citrussy hops. Flavourwise plenty of standard new IPA hops going on, with some bitter melon and sour citrus notes. Quite a refreshing drink, with some persistence in the aftertaste. I’ve had better tasting pints of this on draught, which I remember big quite impressed with, so was a bit disappointed with this bottle not quite living up to memory, but nevertheless still a good beer.

355ml bottle. Pours a clear straw yellow with a frothy white head. Plenty of carbonation rolling up the glass. Looks too much like a supermarket lager for my liking. Thankfully smells nothing like one. Plenty of citrus and tropical fruit in the aroma, with some floral, pine and grassy notes. Citrus, melon and tropical fruit in the taste with a hoppy, piney, slightly pithy finish. Mild to medium body, smooth mouthfeel. Not overly complex. Just a crisp, fruity and very easy to drink IPA!
Would I drink it again? Absolutely, great session gear.

straw, Hazy, white Beerhead, with thin, frothy, and firm foam, Good persistence. Clear citrus aroma in the first impression, such as orange, lemon flowers, and hop resins. Light sweetness, Medium bitterness, slightly oxidation, crispy body. Somehow watery. The taste is thin and colorless, the grains and grass flavors dominate the body and the bitterness is lingering.
A tratti acida, non proprio il mio gusto. Birra comunque dal sapore saporito, molta schiuma e pochissimo il malto.

Citrus aroma with nice grassy notes. Hazy pale yellow color with medium sized white head. Bitter taste, grassy and citrusy, bit bready, floral. Thin body, average carbonation. Easy going, long bitter finish.

Bière 33 cl achetée chez Leclerc. Nez fruité et bien houblonné, ananas,  pamplemousse. En bouche, légère pointe d'acidité, notes de miel. Elle fait moins "IPA" que le nez l'aurait laissé imaginer mais elle est très bonne.

33cl bottle from factory Foods.
Thick white head.  Hazy golden pour.  Lovely bitterness.
Keg. Clear golden. Nose is pineapple, grapefruit,light pine. Tastes pine, melon, grapefruit.
355ml Flasche. Hellgelbes Bier, fester Schaum. Citrus und Kräuterduft. Frisch. Sehr zitronigerGeschmack. Langes Hopfenfinnish. Gefällt mir.

I don't like IPA's. However when looking for a low carb beer, I wanted something more than your normal lager-water piss. As an infrequent IPA drinker, I would never have known this was low carb, low calorie. It's perfectly fine for me. It actually has an identity vs the Michelob Ultra's of the world. It definitely has that IPA hoppy taste.

Bottle 0,33L. Courtesy of Kita. Very clear, pale gold color with small, frothy white head. Aroma of riped tropical fruits like mango, papaya... Taste is light sweet, crispy and floral with light bitter finish. Light to medium body,  dry texture, lively carbonation. Light and refreshing thirst quencher...
Odessa brewfest. Low calorie. Low taste. Not much different than a mass produced lager. Beer flavored seltzer.

Keg. Clear, effervescent golden amber with a small but lasting and lacing white head. Clean citrus, mango, peach and tangerine aromas. Solid biscuity malt body. Mid-weigh, clean and crisp, medium carbonation and a moderate length and intensity bitterness.
Really one of the better IPA's from lagunitas! Light pineapple-tastey beer with notes of honey. Not very IPA-looking, but the taste is definitely there.
Meget lys med lettere groft skum. Meget frugtagtig duft. Smager af citrus med en meget let eftersmag, der kun holder i kort tid. Meget lidt fylde og krop.

33cl bottle.pale yellow colour thin white head.
Little nose ,taste is virtually non existent
Piss poor garbage

On tap. Pours a clear  golden color with a thick head. Aroma of pine grapefruit and grain. Taste of pine, grain and some malt sweetness. some bitterness and a clean finish. Moderate body crisp and refreshing. tasty and an easy drinker.

Un alcool à 4 %, des arômes agréables de fruits exotiques, agrumes et résineux, une fraîche amertume, une faible présence en bouche...nous sommes sur une pure bière de soif qui désaltérera dans le cas de fortes chaleurs mais dont il ne faut pas attendre plus. Même pour le style, la corpulence est bien faiblarde. Joli visuel sur un blond doré limpide, parcouru par de nombreuses fines bulles et surmonté d'une mousse blanche de 5 mm. Le nez met en soif, agréable et bien développé avec fruits exotiques, litchi, ananas, résineux et citron. On s'attend alors à une présence en bouche plus imposante. L'attaque quelque peu troublés par l'effervescence un peu trop marquée manque clairement d'intensité. Texture fine et impression quelque peu aqueuse en bouche. On y décèle tout de même les arômes présents au nez. C'est la seconde bouche qui est la plus marquée, sans réelle complexité toutefois. L’arrière-bouche est insipide sur une fraîcheur en bouche. Quant au final...je le cherche encore. Bof.
A little disappointed with this one. A bit too bitter for me. Perhaps I’ll give it another try.

Light grassy citrusy lemon pine aroma with biscuity malt
Pours a light slightly hazy gold color with small white creamy head
Light citrus hop flavor with light resinous pine. Bready malt
Light bodied with medium high co2, light lingering hoppy bitterness
Refreshing, easy to drink, and enough flavor to keep me interested.  Well done.

Draft at Moriartys. Clear gold pour with thin white foam. No lace. Moderate grassy citrus notes. Slight hop bite. Nothing to offend. Not a great beer but well balanced and much better than your standard Session IPA.
Pale gold with a nice, white head and a mildly citrus nose. Lightly-carbonated with a smooth palate and a mild, citrus finish.
0,355 l bottle from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti, Helsinki (ABV 4,6%). A decent Session IPA, but nothing exceptional.

Goud geel van kleur met een stevige witte schuim kraag. Het bier smaakt verassend zoet en bloemig en heeft een mooie bittere en bloemige nasmaak. In de aroma veel citrus vruchten te proeven en iets kruidigs.
Flaska. Lätt och uppfriskande med inslag av citrus, hö och gräs. Den här kan jag tänka mig att köpa igen när jag är törstig och det är varmt.

Was looking for something “light” without getting a macro-crapo
This hit the spot (I know Lagunitas is owned by Heineken...)
Most sessions are to weak and sappy for me and this is no full flavored brew for sure but it is superior to most lawnmower beers I have had- will prob buy again again

Robe blond paille, limpide. Mousse blanche qui persiste en fine pellicule. Arômes agrumes, floral, fruits jaunes et blancs, résineux, herbe coupée. Goût vif, résineux et agrumes portés par une amertume bien dosée, relevée par la sécheresse de la bière. Carbonatation très fine, légèrement agressive. Très sèche, un peu aqueuse.

Très bon exemple du style. On peut en aligner des pintes facilement.
A tasty session for the daytime. Lacks the strong hop of your typical ipa. From a can on the beach
35.5 cl fles. Helder geel van kleur, middelfijne romige witte schuimkraag. De geur is citrus en mango. Smaak is zoet, mango, mout en licht citrus. Medium lichaam, veel koolzuur.
Bottle - clear , pale yellow,  very small white head. Little carbonation.  Good strong citrus aroma, very pleasant. Slight ting on tongue and in mouth.  Strong citrus taste and finish.
Restrained aroma in a yellow pour.  Hop forward balance with a watery body and thin bitter finish.  Not great given the source.
Pours a very clear pale grayish color with a foamy white head. Light grassy taste. Fairly refreshing and light.

355ml Bottle from Vonk. Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of lemon and grapefruit, floral, hint of resin. Flavour is light sweet, floral, lemon peel and lemon, grapefruit, light bitter finish, light malty, crackers. Light bodied. Nice.

Pale malt light citrus hops nose. Clear pale golden body with white diminishing lace. Taste is medium sweet to bitter. Palate is medium to thin, oily to watery texture average carbonation and a light bitter finish. At a fiver a pint you could drop a twenty without noticing very much
bottle bought from a local supermarket. This beer was light, dry, hoppy and very sessionable drinking beer
Hoppy aroma with medium sweetnedd. White head yellow slightly hazy beer. Light bitterness. Light body, decent dryness in tye finish. Enjoyable.

Bottled 355ml. -from Coop Genova. Paale yellow coloured, small to medium sized airy white head, mild grapefruit and lemon in the nose. Sweetish malty, mild fruity hoppy, notes of grass and grapefruit with soft bitter finish. Nice one.

Bouteille sympa
Jaune pâle mousse blanche 
Nez très frais
Carbonation moyenne et bouche très équilibrée, très légèrement amère, 4 degrés uniquement, une session IPA rafraîchissante!
Robe blonde claire, mousse blanche abondante. Une bonne petite session IPA, herbacé et résineuse, forcément légère. Agréable.

Robe paille limpide, belle mousse carbo correcte. Nez d'agrumes, plutôt agréable. En bouche, du pamplemousse et de l'écorce d'orange, c'est très fruité, assez sec mais relativement équilibré, léger mais goûtu, une IPA facile à boire, et très bonne.
35,5 cl fles. Helder blond bier met wit schuim. Geur: hop, pompelmoes, wat citrus, wat moutzoet. Smaak: wat groene hop, pompelmoes, citrus. Medium koolzuurprikkel.
Aroma 6. Appearance 2. Taste 7. Palate 4. Overall 13. Light hops aroma. Exotic fruits and bitter taste.

I have bought this bottle, in one monoprix, in Paris. Trying it at home, in Epalinges, during the meal. Different color than usual for an IPA, yellow and gold body, clear, average carbonation, a bit sparkling, thin and white foam. The taste has clearly a resinous side, eucalyptus, dry malt, decent hop and bitterness, enough aromatic.

12 fl oz can with a refreshed look, unlike the staid bottle labels! Appearance of the pour is a pale yellow, topped with quite a big, two fingered head of white froth, which persists for a while, but is not so easily regenerated by swirling once it is gone. Aromas are very fruity and hoppy, grapefruit and citrus mainly. Taste is similar to the aromas, sweet citrus for most part. There is little, if any malt flavour or sweetness, and also little of the grapefruit or pine bitter, so it does come across as a sweet soda, with a mild touch of alcohol. Body is light, as expected for a session IPA, so perhaps tere is an absence of malts in this one, but is helped by the above average and effervascent carbonation, which helps it from going watery too soon. Very sessionable and refreshing, flavour is full on, and it does not feel watery or weak at any point.

Colore giallo carico torbido, versa un dito di schiuma. Aroma piuttosto intenso di agrumi, con qualche nota di frutta tropicale. Al gusto si rivela poco strutturata e beverina, con le classiche note agrumate e un retrogusto secco. Birra discreta.

Couleur dorée pâle bien limpide. Mousse généreuse et tenace. Nez très vivace, tout d'abord sur les fruits tropicaux, puis sur l'herbacé/résineux. Mêmes arômes en bouche tout aussi efficace, couplé à une amertume assez balèze. Notes de grains clairs et d'herbacé qui restent longuement en fin de bouche aux côtés de l'amertume. Corps léger, style oblige. Une Session IPA qui rempli correctement son contrat et qui fait clairement le job.
Lagutinas Daytime Ale Fractional IPA 4.6%. Hazy golden, tropical fruit and grapefruit aroma, light bodied, pale ale, tropical fruit, mango, grapefruit. Lovely IPA from California 🇺🇸

Pissgul med fint vitt skum, stora bubblor. Doftar fruktigt och gräsigt, lite tallkåda. Smaken mellanfyllig, besk, lite söt, ganska mycket kolsyra. Eftersmaken lång med med markant beska. Nja, mer IPA än Ale, står "Fractional IPA" på etiketten, lite falsk marknadsföring.
I had this  a long time ago and didn't rate it I guess. An above average session IPA.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso viene attratto dal citrico. La finezza olfattiva è normale e il modo in cui permane è sufficiente. Il manto birroso superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma che resiste poco. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. Il colore è giallo paglierino. Il corpo è rotondo. L'amaro è pronunciato e c'è anche una componente leggermente acidula. La forza gustativa è elevata e la durata è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di facile beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. Al palato finiscono note di zucchero, resina, agrumi, pompelmo rosa e ananas.

Couleur pâle, arôme fruitée exotique, goût un peu sur le fruit aussi (pas caramel, peu résineux), corps léger, facile à boire, amertume présente mais modérée. Une ipa légère en somme, une bonne session ipa.

(Rate 28/05/19: 7-3-6-4-13 = 3.3)
Clear light yellow pour with small white head; reasonable retention. Aroma is mild hoppy, citric, tropical fruit, pineapple. Taste is mild bitter, soft sweet, lemon. Rather light and watery feel, rather strong carbo. This is indeed a light session IPA, refreshing but bit too light.
(Two weeks later drank it again, but now in Edinburgh. Same impression).
(Re-rate 23/06/20: 7-4-7-4-14 = 3.6)
Crystal clear golden pour, and indeed mild hoppy tropical aroma. But this time I find the taste not so watery, but mild bitter, with a soft aftertaste. Nice session IPA.
Bottle from Morrisons. Light gold colour and small foam. Quite a lovely smell, with a citrus crisp taste. It's quite light but is definitely refreshing.

Robe jaune très pale et limpide, mousse blanche moyenne qui ne tient pas trop. Nez léger agréable d'agrumes et de fruits exotiques. En bouche le houblonnage fruité est agréable mais le manque de corps et de longueur rend la bière tout de même très fade. Sinon la carbo est bonne. Bière de soif...

Sample from tap @ Salón piva in Bratislava (3rd day).
F: thin, white, quick gone.
C: straw, clear.
A: citrus, bit tropical fruits, floral, pineapple.
T: light malty base, orange, tangerine, light tropical fruits, citrus, thin body and medium carbonation, very nice, easy drinkable, enjoyable.
Bottle 33cl a clear yellow beer with low head. Nose is very lemony aroma is low on agrume hops, touch of coconut. very low body, why brewing this ? Extreamly boring and low.
Jaune claire, légère mousse. Nez houblonné exotique. Gout exotique et sapin, notes acidulée agrumes. Corps moyen. Mais pas mal pour une cession ipa.

Bottle.
Slightly hazy pour, small white head. 
Lovely floral nose. Taste is crisp and hoppy, just what i expect from an IPA. 
Medium body, average carbonation.
Tout est dans le titre ! Idéale avant-midi si l'on a une petite soif de houblon sans rechercher l'ivresse grâce a ces petits 4%...

Bottle, 0.355l. Aroma of caramel, resin, pineapple and mango. Pours clear pale golden color with thin creamy white head and sparkling appearance. Taste starts light sweet malty, following is citrusy, floral and grassy, mouthfeel is smooth, while finish is light to medium bitter with durable aftertaste. Light body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Simple and tasty daily companion...

Can. Gold pour, off white head. Citrus nose with a hint of malt. Watery mouthfeel but malt and hops in the background. Per their website this only has 98 calories per can. Impressive flavor for a light beer.

Tap at Salon piva. Quite standard session IPA. Exactly what I am looking for in this style. Easy drinking, very thin body, rather high carbonation. Mosaicy, citrusy, resiny hoppiness. Easy drinking. Quite good.
Salon piva. Golden color with medium white head. Nice citrus hoppy aroma. Taste, solid malty base followed by nice hoppy kick with zest, pines. Medium long hoppy bitter finish.
Flaska från SB, god smak av exotiska frukter, hint av tallbarr. Bra humlad och trevlig, alkoholsvag men trots det ganskanfyllig kropp.

On tap at Magnolia Music Festival in North FL.  Was happy to have Lagunitas as the craft beer choice, so tried this over their stronger/standard IPA which I had plenty of times.  Very good for a session IPA.  Keeps those hoppy and citrus notes while retaining the flavor, but a more watery and lighter version.  The seasons have already changed, so most likely waiting until spring/summer for the full 6-pack sample, but this is one of the newer sessions that I will definitely return to.

Can from Joe’s Beverage Warehouse.  Clear light gold body with a clinging white head.  Aroma of light citrus, herbal hops, and dish soap.  Not terribly inviting but not offensive.  Bright palate with nice carbonation.  Citrus and herbal hops flavor finishes clean.  It’s a thirst quencher.  Not too bad.
clear, light gold color; bright, citrusy hop aroma; very light, crisp, and bitterwith citrusy hop notes

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, cytrusy, trawa. Kolor słomkowy, opalizujące. Piana niska, drobna, szybko znika. W smaku lekka słodycz, niska pełnia, słód, trawa, cytrusy, kwiaty, ziemia. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie wysokie.
Bottle at the pub. Medium creamy amber with a thin head. Scent is fairly mild dogfood notes on cereal malt. Taste is very mild, somewhat stinky hops ale. Uninteresting. Fine.
IPA Lite. Straw-like malts with tiny notes of grapefruit, white bread, and a seltzer-ish finish. Calling this a “Session IPA” is passe, I guess.
Bottle from home bargains Lincoln. As DayTime Fractional IPA 4.6%. Light hazy pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma has citrus and slight floral. Taste light bitter. Medium body.

35,5cl bottle, pale yellow color, minimal white head, malt aroma with citrus (lemon) and tropical notes, almost neutral flavor, light body, fresh finish with some hops, light and refreshing as promised, fredda perfetta per quando si ha sete e siccome avevo sete mi ha dissetato, potrebbe rendere bene anche come aperitivo poco alcolico

Tap into pint. Bit darker than Budweiser yellow but close. Lemon pith nose, in the mouth, very light. Unpleasant lemon astringency that lingers. Light certain grain impression. I appreciate the effort but don't feel the result.
Bottle 33 cl. Golden, cloudy with a medium white head. Hops and floral aroma. Light bitterness with a mild hop end. Nice for a low alc beer, but want more of the good stuff.

Bottle 0.355L.
Clear golden body with an average, fizzy, white head, mostly diminishing with some lacing, though; high density of tiny particles.
Moderate-to-heavy hoppy (citrus, grapefruit, flowers) with notes of fruits (peach).
Light-to-moderate bitter and light sweet flavour; average-lasting balanced finish.
Light body with watery texture; average carbonation.

From bottle, pours yellow/golden, clear with small white head. Hops and herbal aroma, taste is light bitterness, light body, long finish, average carbonation. Nothing special, just another boring ipa.

On bottle. Pours almost clear yellow, with frothy white head.
Scent: Fruity and floral.
Taste: Small bitterness in the aftertaste, light and fresh. 
Texture: Medium carbonation.

Can. Pours a clear straw with a one finger bright white head. Aroma is classic IPA, tropical fruits and some sweet malts. Taste is semi hollow with a very light bitter finish. Although it’s taste falls short it makes up for it with aroma and drinkability. My new favorite session beer.

Didn’t pour it out of the 12oz bottle.

Aroma is a vert strong, artificial lemon, as in ReaLemon.

Flavor is also very strong on the ReaLemon, with very little other flavor coming through— not impressed. Not sure where the reviewer claiming multiple fruits flavors is getting those flavors from, but it’s not this beer.

Overall, quite disappointed and glad I only purchased one, as part of a build-your-own 6-pack.

I look forward to trying Doggish Head’s release of a low-cal IPA in April ‘19.
Can. Pale yellow color poured with a white head. It has a citrus and pine aroma. Thin, watery and light.  Can drive k a lot of these at 4%.

Kolor złoty, słomkowy z lekką mgiełką. Piana biała, bujna, wysoka,o długim czasie redukcji. 
Aromat bardzo świeży, rześki, owocowy. Niestety ale wydaje mi się jakby wkradło się tam też zakażenie.
Smak podobnie bardzo świeży, owocowy. Jest lekko, orzeźwiająco. Goryczka niska, nawet skłonny jestem powiedzieć, że nieobecna - nie wiem skąd to 54 (IBU).
Wysycenie wysokie, lekko szczypie w język. Ciała brak, piwo jest bardzo wodniste.
Pale golden color, small white head. Aromas of citrus, hops, pine and bread. Bitter taste with grapefruit, lemons, resin and bread.

Straw gold, with a frothy, fizzy bright white head. Smells of grass and lemon and pineapple juice.  Taste is grassy, hint of citrus, almost with a skunky finish which I quite liked.  Lots of flavor here.

Best damn low calorie beer ever!

Pours a clear yellow with a full white head that laces. Nose hoppy but not resinous. Taste is light malt with a hop structure leaving a mild bitterness. Body is light. It is now 98 calories! The bent nail of the can is real - They nailed it! 12 oz can Could not read the date stamp. Why do they do this code thing?

July 27th, 2015 - Refreshing and light, the Daytime IPA is a brighter yellow color with a thickness that clouds our plastic taste here at the Lagunitas brewpub. The aroma is light, too, with a fresh hops note. And again, the taste features a clear and light palate with a more continental hops edge. Quenching and clear, this is a great session IPA, and my new personal favorite in the category.

Pale, slightly cloudy straw yellow in colour with very little head. Smells sweet but hazy, like grapefruit and hops. Taste is quite earthy, dissipates quickly into cut grass, hops and slight lemon peel. A lovely bitter sourness lingers on the tongue. Tastes like sitting by a field on a Summer's day.

Bottle purchased from Føtex, Midtjylland, Denmark.

light yellow color. smell hoppy aroma. The taste is slightly bitter. The body is light
colore giallo chiaro. al naso profumo luppolato. Il gusto è lievemente amaro. Il corpo è leggero
Light yellow colour, practicaly no foam. Fizzy, bitterness is quite plain and the taste is not complicated, a bit of sourness present.
Dagligen kan jag utsätta mig för denna lunchdryck. Den traditionella smaken och karaktären hos Lagunita späs med lite vatten. Voilà

355 ml bottle. Pours a bright gold with light bubbly head. Aromas of candied fruit and soft malts. Flavors follow with additional sweet tropical fruit, tangerines and a bit of cardboard. Light but tasty
Bottle. Not the most hoppy of IPAs, quite gentle: a session IPA. Not that bitter finish at all, somewhat surprising.

Pours somewhat hazy yellow golden, topped with medium sized, medium lasting white head. Gentle sweet fruity nose with resin character, some citruses. Milder bitterness, citrusy and sweet fruity feel. Short aftertaste. Pretty water body, a bit empty taste as well. Not bad, but a bit too bland.
Pours from the bottle clear clear light strew color with no head, passion fruit on the nose, crisp, a little sweet with pine in the neck

Lukt: Humlete; tropisk?, gress, skog
Smak: med malt; lyse korn. Humlete; grønt, skog, gress?, kanskje litt tropisk.
En frisk og balansert øl. Godt med både sødme og bitterhet i denne. Klar i smaken. Klarer å utnytte det spillerommet den har. Prøver ikke på noe mer enn det. 
7,0/10
181113

Flaska 355 ml från Systembolaget. Blekt gul med lätt skum, ser inte så kul ut. Doft av humle och tropiska frukter. Smak av humle, tropiska frukter och tallbarr, ganska rejäl beska. Ganska "tunn" för att vara en Lagunitas, men detta är en alkoholsvag variant som är avsedd för att kunna drickas i större volymer. Helt ok för vissa tillfällen.

Bottle. Pours a clear straw colour with a medium white head. Aroma of pine, some lemon, subtle grapefruit and slight grassy hops. Taste of grapefruit, pine, slight lemon, a hint of pale malts and subtle grassy hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A dryish, piney and citrus hop bitterness in the finish. Light in flavour, bitterness and body, but it’s quite refreshing.
Bottle. Clear golden with a big head, nice lacing. Smell of citrus hops, grassy, green. Sweetish, grainy, grassy, lemon, zesty, grapefruit, bitter finish. Light bodied, smooth. Nice.

Bottle. Crystal clear pale yellow with soapy white head. The aroma is very hoppy with notes of citrus (grapefruit), onion, herbs, juicy. The flavor is bitter with notes of citrus (grapefruit), herbs, "green", onion, no maltiness, very clean and juicy. Light-bodied.
12oz bottle pours out pale straw topped with a white head. Nose is floral hops some citrus and crisp malts. Taste is more of the nice light crisp hop combo and a well balanced light malt.
Tyvärr en besvikelse tycker jag. Väl smaklös och intetsägande. Lagunitas brukar leverera men är redan glömd.
Bottle from supermarket. Clear bubbly gold with a white head. Nice grassy hop aroma with citrus. Lemon and lime to the fore. Not much bitterness- sweet and refreshing,
Aroma is peach waldmeister lemonade herbs mirabelle citrus. Taste is bitter herbal hops with fruity bitter base. Juicy. Not so balanced. Still drinkable. Nice.

33 cl bottle from Tosano. Yellow color big bubbly white head, smell of fresh american hops, citrus. Taste hoppy, citrusy with mild malt and grain. Very carbonated, taste is crisp, citrusy, light sour. Watery texture, thin body, refreshing finish, sessionable indeed.

Tydlig Lagunita-signatur med tropisk arom men ändå hyfsat maltbaserad smak. En hel del bäska tränger igenom en ganska tunn maltkropp. Men så ska man ju orka med att dricka den här dagtid också. Ett jävla märkligt ölkoncept.
0,35l bottle. Pours cloudy straw with white head. Aroma is plenty of citrus, fruity, fresh, tropical fruits. Taste is crisp, fresh, lemon peel, hoppy. Everything you'd want in a session IPA.
Flaske fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Drukket på Lillehøgda. Lys varm gylden. Lavt skum. Litt uklar. Lett ferskenroma. Smaken pærer & ananas. Litt syrlig etter hvert.

355ml bottle. Pours hazy lemom gold with a large head. Aroma is straw and sherbet lemon. 
Taste has straw throughout with a little lemon on the finish.
Bottle, Morrisons, Leicester. Hazy yellow gold with a thin head. Toasted grain malts with zesty, tart lemon. Spicy. Dusty with pithy grapefruit. Minerals. Underlying tropical sweetness. Pretty good.

35,5cl bottle from Viking XPRS. Pours clear, pale golden with a white head. Fresh and fruity aroma with tropical fruits dominating, some light citrus and hints of malt and wheat. Moderate sweet with nice fruity flavours and a pleasant bitterness. Light, sessionable and refreshing.
Aroma of tropical fruits and pine. Golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium + bitter. Medium body with average carbonation. Overall a nice refreshing Pale Ale.

Pale golden with a white head - Hop aroma with citrus and some herbal tones - Malt body with hops that gives citrus and herbla hop flavours with bitterness - The hop flavours gors into a dry fruity finish - This was nice
Bottle from Coop obs. Clear, golden. Citrus, lemon, fruit. Sweet and bitter. Thin. Decent at this abv.
Lys gul med medium høyt hvitt skum. Aroma milde tropiske frukter. Ananas. Smaken er mild av furu, akkompagnert av de før nevnte tropiske frukter. Mildt bitter, tynn konsistens.

Bottle. Golden with a clear appearance.Slightly hoppy with some spiceness in the background. Rather thin and lacking personality. This makes it not really attractive although I wouldn't class it as a bad beer.
Very light colour like lager with a fruity aroma and taste. A nice bitter taste but not that strong  good for a light IPA

Bottle.
Pours crystal cler golden yellow with one and half white head.
Light citrsy aroma with sweet tones of mango and peach. Some light cerealy notes too.
Taste is light bittersweet with a crispy malt backbone.
Medium body but not watery. Very drinkable and refreshing.
Nice light IPA, ideal start for a hot Summer night session.
Tap at Museum Tavern, next to British Museum. Aroma of tropical fruit, citrus and grass. Clear golden body with white head. Bitter taste with tropical fruit, citrus and grass. Good pale.

Bottle from Pivný raj
Bit sweetish but well rounded ale. Very easy drinking, very smooth. Well done Heineken.
Gulbrun klar med fingerhøyt hvitt skum. Lukter lime, ananas og papaya. Middels- i fylde. Lett bitter sitrus, noe ananas og granbar. Middels lang.

355 ml bottle, from Coop Extra, Sauda. ABV is 4.6%. Clear pale golden colour, moderate white head. Nice aroma of fruity hops (citrus, tropical fruits). Light bodied. Medium dry flavour with piney and grapefruity hops.
Flaska från SB. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Lätt och friskt humlig i doft och smak.
Pint from tap at Flat Iron Square. Light yellow, and light body. Very drinkable in summer, hoppy with hints of citrus.
Poors light yellow, white short lasting foam. head. Quit hoppy aroma and bitter taste, did not expect that. (Edingburg 201806)

bottle @ home
clear golden copper, white head
herbaceous not so balanced..
Fruity aroma, tutti frutti and candy. Some citrus also. Mild taste, exotic fruits. Grapefruit.

Bottle @ Fox and Hounds, Sønderborg. Unclear golden body with a medium sized white head. Fresh and fruity aroma with peach, passion fruit, pale malt and red berries. Flavor is light, fruity and refreshing. Fruity like aroma, smooth pale malt and slightly acidic berries with moderate bitterness. Medium body and fresh, fruity aftertaste. A rather light one, but very nice and tasty.

12oz bottle from Morrisons, Bracknell. A very pale amber pour with a loose cream head; tropical fruit aroma; rather thin in the mouth with tropical fruit to start then a touch of pine; and a dry but very thin finish. Pleasant and refreshing, but rather unexciting.

Bottle. Pale and faintly hazy gold, fluffy and lasting white head and moderate condition. Pleasant sweet grapefruit citrus hops and muted grain in the nose, soft and sweet in the mouth with restrained citrus hop notes, fruity malt and a gentle chalky bitterness, finish has a pleasant peppery hop note with a low lingering grapefruit note.

Appearance-  Pale yellow colour with large but weak white foam. 


  Aromas-  Sweet and malty with strong honey (almost like biscuits with honey on top) notes and grassy hops as well as a touch of earl grey tea. 


  Palate-  Medium/full body with smooth and flat texture leaving sweet somewhat dry finish. 


  Taste-  Sweet and malty, with honey and grassy touches, later developing slight herbal bitterness. Nothing too fancy. 


  Overall-  Yeh, okay, nothing bad but nothing fun, just your average beer, with fairly nice aromas and body, rest is mediocre.

Lagunitas DayTime
Session IPA
747414


Lukt: Citrus, honning.
Utseende: Lys gul.
Skum/kullsyre: Tykt skum, heng.
Smak: Citrus, honning.
Hvor: Samling hos Bryne.
Medium: Flaske@355ml, ABV@4,7%, Når@02.06.2018.
Vycap urban house. Draheeee, ale vona krasna citrusova. Farba bledo zlta. Chut prijemna osviezujuca citrusova.
Straw colour with white head. Pine and citrus aroma. Crispy, citric and fresh in mouth. Moderated bitterness. Tasted in Olut de Cata.
Tapped at Hangout in Bratislava Slovakia. It's a lagunitas! Fantastic exotic beer in aroma and taste. Super refreshing. Floral, citrusy, easy drinkable beer. Trend setter. A.classic.
Flaska från SB. Klar, gyllengul kulör med vit skumkrona. Doft och smak av tall, citrus, rostad malt och lite ananas.
Fin humlet med midt sødme. Ikke det mest spændende øl der også mangler lidt spænding .
0,3 litre Bottle from Coop Obs Olrud. Clear light Golden with white head. Malts, hops and Tropical aroma and taste. Bitter.

Light golden with little foam that rapidly disapears. Pine, cumin, citrus and malt at the nose. Light, slightly sour mouthfill with ok length. The brewery makes other far better brews than this one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Golden body with white large lasting head. Aroma is fruity pines. Taste is fruity citrus some resin and malts. Aftertaste is nice balanced.

Bottle. Pale, yellow color with fine white head. Nose is strong tropical fruit, pineapple, mango. Taste is very dry with bitter finish. Aroma is unfortunately short-lived.
Upped rating to 3.7 in August 2019.

How: Bottle.

Where: On the train to Copenhagen.

Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.

Aroma: Tropical fruit, hops, a bit floral.

Body: Medium body and carbonation.

Flavour: Fruit, malt, hops.

Bottled 0,355L. Clear and pale yellow hazy color, much lively aspect with good bubbly and medium resistance white head duration. Very rich and pleasant aroma, decided hoppy and citric nose, grass, pale malt, citrusy, soft tropical smell, mango, resin. Good prickly mouth, pleasant sweet/bitter body, equilibrate citrusy and hoppy palate. Thanks to Marco Z. for this one.
Flaska Bishops Örebro. Gyllengul vätska. Pigg doft av gräs och citrus. Dankig. Lätt men ganska smakrik. Frisk citruston med örtig känsla på en helt ok beska. Bra session

Bottle from Asda, High Wycombe. Dull gold with a thin white head. Light peach and lemon with a hint of thyme set against a slightly soapy background. Flavours are a bit wishy-washy, bit of a nothing beer. Something skanky in the aftertaste too. Bleagh.

Tap at Salon piva 4/ 2018. Hopy aroma, citrus fruit, grassy notes. Light hazy yellow color, white head. Hopy taste, citrus fruit, grassy notes, medium bitter. Light to med body, slick texture, soft carbonation and hopy bitter finish. Very good.

355ml bottle. Clear pale yellow with a frothy white head. Fruity aroma with lemon, peach, and light malts. Taste of lemon, peach, sweet malts, minerals, light bitter finish. Light body, average carbonation.

Pours honey golden hazy, white foam,, Medium retention.  Fruity nose, grape fruit, orange, honey melon. Taste is fresh and on the light side with a medium bitter finish.  Slight malt and fruity notes. Nice beer.

Fra flaske.
Meget lys og næsten helt klar. 
Frisk aroma af humle og fersken.
Smagen er let og bitter. Meget letdrikkelig.
ipa semplice, giallo chiaro limpido, poca schiuma, al naso sentori agrumati, al palato un poco fruttata e poi si avverte l'agrume specie pompelmo, discreto amaro, media carbonazione, corpo leggero

12 oz bottle. Pours a pale gold with a frothy white small head. Scents of citrys and lemon zest. Fresh crisp taste of lemon and malt balanced extremely well. Above average carbonation. Short roundly sour finish. Super drinkable.
Bottle on board Sj tåg. Very decent and did the job. Kinda odd to have a Lagunitas that isn't meaty in the alcohol department for a change but it's nice.

July 2017. Bottle. Bonus point for the quirky ABV. Streaming gold with an insistent lacy foam. Peach, coconut, dried pine needle, almost rosemary on the snout. Fine and soapy with dominant floral and zesty grapefruit hops over a lean chaff and nut-husk base. Sudden finish lacking the juicy hop-malt bittersweetness that characterises the finest GAs or SIPAs. Straightforward and soapy with almost a tired cask (northern) English feel.
An american, golden, near clear, dry hopped Session IPA with white head. Aroma is malt, hops, pine, green herbs. Taste is bitter. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy pale yellow with medium white head. Aroma is make, grapefruit, fashion fruit, lemon and roses. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium to very bitter and light acidic. Body is watery with sparkling carbonation. Finish is long and mostly bitter with notes of grapefruit, yoghurt, passion fruit and lemon.
Great tasty brew. Easy and smooth to sip of.... dry, fruity well balanced, citric, rather thin palate but a fine brew. Og eg timid eiinki meira at fáa á skrifti....

Bottle. 4.65%. Best before 07.11.18. Pours a clear, pale yellow, with an off-white head. Bit of lacing. Sweetish, crisp, somewhat juicy, citrus hop aroma; grape fruit. A wee bit funky. Overall good, well-made and -balanced, with a clear profile. Easy to drink. 02.03.18.

Rating #1246, flaske fra Netto Nysted. Meget lys gul øl med lille skum. Humlet aroma med en del lavendel og hindbær. Smagen har også en del lavendel og hindbær, samt en smør-agtig humletilstedeværelse. Let bitterhed. Meget blød, olieret og let i munden. Ganske udmærket øl .
bottle enjoyed at home, pours golden with frothy but not lasting foam. nice aroma of hops, well balanced biterness and maltiness
Ah, sorry. Mistook it for a beer, you know, it being in a bottle.  My mistake of course, I should have noticed it was a grapefruit. Doesn’t even taste of hops. Utterly, yes utterly, disappointing.
Golden coloured beer with a medium white head. Aroma of floral and pine. Taste is hops, citrus, and floral. Medium to heavy palate.
Pale golden with white head. Aroma is papaya, pine apple and citrus. Taste is orange peel, tropical fruit and hay.

Piss pale color, tiny white head.

Aroma: seasalt, light citrus, wheat.
Taste: Citrus, wheat, semi bitter ending, probarly better on a summer day.

Persistent foam. Beautiful aroma of orange peel and apricot. In the taste you will find orange, apricot, pineapple and grape. It is an easily accessible IPA with the main theme of the aforementioned fruits, but a little pine needles blend towards the end and a light caramel malt also comes as a taste. An elegant and tasty IPA. I am becoming more and more supporter of this beer type as I get more of them. This is tolerant, very tasteful and without an IBU that lambs the taste buds.
Bottle. Clear yellow pour with white head. Awesome aroma with peaches and melons. Taste is fresh and bitter. Very nice. Light body. Medium carbonation

I found it a bit boring - gives me an aftertaste of low alcohol. They brew great beers however this is not one of them

Nice light Ale from Lagunitas. I like bitter IPA's, so this Ale is right up my alley. But for an Ale in general, it might be too bitter. Hop flavors dominate the taste. Not many malty flavors.

Bottled, 355ml from Asda in Milton Keynes, Bucks. Gold with white head. There is a herby crispness to this, sharp hopped notes on a cut glass malted body. Refreshing and lightly drying. Very pleasant.
130117. Bottle at home. Pours clear golden with a nice head. Aroma pine, citrus. Nice house tasty feel to this. Good balance. Not Bad.

Strangely enough, I was still fired from my job even though the branding assures me that if I neck a few at lunch time, I'll still be able to carry on like a normal human being. Clear golden, white head. Citrus hoppy aroma, a little lime, some grapefruit. Bittersweet citrus flavour, fruity with light malt backing.

Bottle @ Champagnegallop w friends/Don. Appearance: pours slightly cloudy yellow with good off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste notes: barley, breed, citrus and grapefruit. palette: strong us hoppy aroma, average carbonation, medium body, average sweetness, balanced by an average to notable bitterness, medium duration and a watery texture. Aroma: Fruity hops and oats.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours yellow with a slight haze and a small, white head. Lovely fresh citrusy and tropical aroma - super delish. Light body, dry and fruity but no real malt imprint at all - it's really all about the aroma here since the beer has hardly any bitterness. For a light weight IPA this really hits the spot. 071217
Bottle at the Railway in Witham. Nicely balanced, some tropical fruits, decent hop, slight yeast. Enjoyable session beer.
Hazy straw/gold color; Light to medium body; Aroma of floral hops, pine, & citrus; Flavor of malt, pine hops, and citrus (notably grapefruit); Finish is fairly bitter; Decent.

Butelka 355ml. Jasno-zlote z białą ,niska piana, która szybko redukuje się bdo obręczy. Świeży aromat cytrusów i owoców tropikalnych z lekką nutą sosnową. W smaku owoce ,mango i marakuja na czele wspierana przez cytrusy ,trawe. Orzeźwiające

Bottle@: light slightly hazy golden with dissipating white foamy head. Clean crisp, biscuity malt flavor, supported by citrusy, fruity hop profile. Medium to full hop bitterness which lingers in aftertaste. Medium bodied, smooth texture, moderate carbonation.
bottled - pale yellow color. Sweet hoppy aroma. Great hop flavor. Crisp and refreshing.

Golden light yellow beer with smallish head. Aroma has tropical sweet fruits, passion fruit maybe, grapefruit too, sweet barley and wheat also. Taste has nice sweet barley and wheat malt base and then some tropical sweet fruits and ending in grapefruit bitterness. Mediumish body with medium carbonation.
Clear pale color with white head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity, citrus. Taste is light bitter, sweetish. Generally a good beer, but nothing extra ordinary.
God velsmagende øl med tilpas bitterhed. Dejlig frisk øl, Kedeligt udseende,

Bottle. Pours very pale not much head. Big complex hoppy aroma, citrus, promises much. The taste is dry and bitter but doesn't really deliver on the olfactory promise. Certainly a session IPA, but nothing earthshaking.
Twelve ounce bottle - pours a straw color with a coarse bubbly white head, fairly unstable. Dank hop aroma, some pine, florals and grain. Crisp and fresh on the tongue.

Good citrusy notes with a tropical hint, golden with a good white head, light body, medium carbonation, taste is similar but not very intense (maybe my bottle was a bit too old), quite refreshing...good.
Clear, gold color with a hyper-fizzy head of sustainable foam. Light trilopical, and soft orange citrus notes
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are citrus, tropical fruits, hops, flowers and malt. Citrussy and light bitter finish.
355 ml bitter from Føtex Viby. Pours very clear golden with a small white head. Its light, smooth and hoppy, very drinkable session IPA.
S: tropical fruit, hoppy, malt A: clear yellow,  minimal head T: med/high bitterness, slight sweet finish P: refreshing

Kwg at Rose & Thistle, Frimley Green. Floral and grassy aroma, citrus. A hazy light gold. Frothy white head. Light bitter. Sour citrus edge. Burnt bitter finish. Light bodied. Some slickness to it. Soft carbonation. Relatively abrupt finish. Could drink it all day. Refreshing session beer.

Wow. So moreish and I sessions on it. The slight watery finish was good as made it not cloying. Lovely fresh tropical fruit and grapefruit espesh to fore. Head nice with slight haze to look. Belter from asda. Could wean the hard core lager only ppl no problem. So easy drunk.

Nice easy drinkable and very session able beer. 
Hazy pale golden color with å fine white head. Ok hoppy aroma. Medium body and an average carbonation level. Fine bitterness and a semi dry ending. Citric, pine, fruity and a quite malty flavor. 
[On tap at The Spaniards Inn in Hampstead - Greater London, England]

drank from the bottle on a night out in hereford, recently. could not see colour as venue was dark, however comes with a toasted undercurrent and a big bitter hop finish. a bit typical over the style but very easy going and very easy drinking. good stuff.

Medium bodied, a bit thin on the back. Very prickly on the palate. Dry.
Taste is very much as the aroma, lemon, bitter citrus, pine & quite hoppy with long bitter finish.
355ml bottle from Whole Foods UK,Smells good, tastes good, very refreshing, not as complex as others, but very enjoyable and great in the day! Have purchased before and will purchase again.
Draught at KØ17. Citric and fruity aroma. Cloudy yellow colour. Big stable white head. The flavour is citric and slightly funky. Quite well-balanced. Fruity and refreshing.

355ml bottle thanks to Colin. 
Small white head, good lacing. Clear pale golden body. Light pineapple on the nose, some straw. Flavour is pineapple, grapefruit, straw. Medium carbonation, clean mouthfeel, a little thin. Decent easy drinking pale ale.

Bottle. Light yellow, very clear with medium, not very solid, white head and some lacing. Pleasant and quite strong hoppy aromas with grassy notes, noting extraordinary but good enough. EDIT: another batch, 6 months later. Good lacing, not so watery and a lot of hoppy flavors in taste. Looks to be much more fresh.

Overrated. Didn't move the needle beyond a mass produced beer. Smells nice though

355ml bottle. Crystal clear, yellow-ish golden colour with average, fluffy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, snow-white head. Taste is dry, fruity hoppy, slightly grassy, hints of nectarine, peach, mango, mandarine; pale malty basis with some residual sweetness. Very clean, almost a bit sterile.

opalescent pale yellow colour, moderate sized, quickly disappearing off-white head; aroma of grapefruit, pine notes, some rotten mango and hints of biscuits, taste is the same with slight dill notes; good beer, though not an extraordinary masterpiece

Bottle, pours deep gold with a fluffy head and aromas of mango, melon and orange. Medium herbal dry-bitterness over fruity-sweet maltiness. Tasty.

Listen, sometimes you gotta take a break from the DIPAs and imperial stouts and just have a tasty, relatively low ABV beer to chug and this one fits the bill very well. It has a light citrus and hops smell and pours the standard light amber pale ale color. The flavor is subtle, but present, giving you enough hoppy flavor to keep you interested, but not in such quantities that it destroys your palate or forces you to pace yourself. One of my very favorite session beers. Good for taking a number 2 before catching a train to NYC for a Gorguts/Artificial Brain show. \m/

bottle bb 7/3/18 dorata limpida buona schiuma media persistenza buona lippolatura leggermente agrimata resinosa non esplosiva fragrante ma non fastidiosa secca amaro medio lievi note tropicale lieve vegetale
DØE. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 190517

Bottle poured into a shaker glass. Pale yellow color and a billowing white head. Pine, pale malt, and not much else in the aroma. Initial taste is lemon, mango, pine, and pale malt. Probably about as close as Lagunitas will ever get to something on the lighter end of the spectrum.

Bottle from ASDA, Keighley. Yellow-blonde with a thick bubbly head. Sessionably hoppy with light fruity notes, and these are better stated in its nose. Has a disappointingly short aftertaste, which makes it feel a little thin.

355ml bottle. Pours lemon with a small white head. Nose of pine resin, grapefruit, mango, apricot and caramel malt. Light carbonation, thin mouth feel. Taste is pine resin, mango, apricot and sweet malts. Very fruity, refreshing and a nice dry bitter finish. Tasty stuff.
Golden with a white head. Pine resin aroma. Citrusy, hoppy flavor. Thin watery body, nice mildly bitter finish.

Birra dal color oro scarico. Schiuma bianca, persistente e fine. Al naso sentori di frutti esotici, ananas, mango, frutto della passione e pesca gialla. Al palato corpo leggero, si e ripresentano gli stessi sentori percepiti con l?olfatto. Nel finale secca e amara. Il dry hopping la fa da padrona. Un birra piacevole, ma solo una...se no stanca.

11-MAY-2017, bottle @home, from Meny. Clear golden with a nice, white head.
Aroma is citrus and toasted malt. Taste the same. Sweet, bitter, thin body, average carbonation.

355 ml bottle. Hazy, golden colour with a medium sized white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, floral hops, exotic fruits, apricot, peaches and pines. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Some hops oils. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits and tropical nuances. Lovely lighter IPA.
355ml bottle. Very pale golden beer with a decent white head. Light citrus aroma, taste is lime and tropical fruit. Ok

12-ounce bottle pours hazy pale yellow/straw color. Aroma: peach, pineapple, pine needles. Flavor: all of the above, plus mango and pineapple. Super, super light, virtually no mouthfeel, but definitely poundable.
Bottle from Asda. Nose is is lime, slight tropical. Taste is light tropical, lemon and citrus flavours, cereal, light malt, light pine. It’s serviceable, and certainly session able, but bland.

Bottle 12 ounce poured to wine glass, with meal	
Appearance: Light amber, small head, almost no lacing

drank: Thursday, April 13, 2017	5:30 PM

Bottle from Asda. This came in under the radar, but is a surprise hit. Pale gold, frothy white top, with great lacing (soft like a spiderwebs). Taste is rich, hoppy, thickly murky. Excellent depth for the abv. Fresh, tasty, flavoursome. Really good. Great value too.

Bottle from ASDA. Pale gold in colour, with a slight, white, head and a touch of carbonation. Sweetish, tropical fruit and grassy hop aroma. Flavour had grapefruit, pineapple and mags notes, with some crisp malts and a dryish finish. Very drinkable.

(Bottle, Platåkåtan, Åre, 23 March 2017) Golden yellow colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with citrus, grapefruit, and lots of fresh floral hops. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of citrus, grapefruit, lemon peel, passion-fruit, a touch of resin, biscuits and lots of fresh citric/floral hops in a finish with a balanced bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Fresh and tasty. Nice one.

Bottle frae local Asdas. Pours with a slight golden, lemon-yellow haze. Has a bit of a green tint about it. Bright white head. Aroma has some tropical pineapple and light passion fruit. Some zesty grapefruit. A little lemonade. Very light biscuity malt. It’s a little light all round actually. Taste is thin-ish with some oily citrus. More lemon. More grapefruit. Sweet bready malts. Bitter enough. Medium spritz on the carbonation. Definitely sessionable. Not bad.
Clear, light gold color with a hyper-fizzy head of sustainable foam. Skunk, light trilopical, and soft orange citrus notes. Light and quenching.

Bottle from Asda, Great Barr. Slightly hazy golden beer with medium head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus and light malt. Taste is tropical fruits, some sherbet, citrus and a hint of pine resin. Refreshing.

Bottle from Asda. Nice aroma. Very pale lemon colour. Slightly subtly sweet, then watery bitterness. A good easy-goer. Pleasant.

Light yellow colour with white foam. Hops and citrus in the aroma. Dry hops in the taste
Flaska. Klar gul/guld med ett vitt skum. Dofter och smaker av tropisk frukt, tall och gräs. För att vara en session-IPA så är kroppen ovanligt stor. Snyggt.

Perfect session beer, or better yet as a ’first’ beer before having something more substantial. Amazing that a brew that is within a whisker of either Coor Light or Bud Light in ABV can actually satisfy a palate in regard to hoppiness. Bravo

pours a straw gold with a medium white head. grapefruit and lemon citrus aroma. bright citrus taste at first then the hop bitter fades in. Pleasant medium bitter finish and linger. Pretty good session IPA.
Aroma of grapefruit and pine, the hops outperform the malts on this one. There is very little noticeable maltiness. Needs more balance, not for me.

New rate 10.1.20. Keg at the Marquis Wellington, Leicester. Taste is sweet and simple with gooseberry and grape notes. Much better than the previous bottle which may have been a bit old. New rate: 7-4-7-3-13 = 3.5, old rate 7-4-3-3-10 = 2.7, average 3.1.

Bottle from Crown & Shuttle, Shoreditch. A nice straw colour, with a fair bit of visible carbonation. Lovely if a bit muted citrus and peppery hop odour. Some wood shavings, gardenia, hay. The taste is not forthcoming. You think it is going to hit and then - doesn’t. It’s bittersweet, slightly hoppy but very very muted. Finish is not so much short as nonexistent. This is a pretty egregious fail from a very good brewery. Meh meh meh.

12oz bottle thanks to Andrea. It pours a clean pale straw color with a medium white head. Aroma is clean and fruity, juicy with notes of melon and persimmon. Taste is also medium fruity and grassy with notes of persimmon and straw. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very nice

Tap@Kompasset. Pours almost clear light golden with white head. Aroma has notes of malt but is otherwise hoppy with citrus, grass and a hint of pine. Taste is quite crisp and fresh, lightly malty and hoppy with citrus, a hint of pine and grass. Quite lightbodied and easygoing, straight forward and lightly watery. Finish is dry and light.

Draught at Taphouse.
Hazy yellow colored with notes medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus and basil.
Fruity flavor of hops, candies and citrus.
Hoppy finish.

Privately tasty, piney hoppiness, ale suggestive, crisp, and satisfying. Thirst quenching. A very low-key "day-time". When you still need to do a whole lot of things perfectly before your day ends, this is the perfect beer.

And I can hardly wait for those hot summer weekends when it will be a fantastic companion for sweaty hard work. Pop one of these when you’re done, sit back, and admire your handiwork.

Bottle from Whole Foods. Bright clear golden color with the lazy white head you expect from Lagunitas. Aroma is grapefruit, pineapple, pine (the tree, not the apple from said tree), toast. Flavor has bready malt, light toast, medium hoppiness, citrusy and piney. Lighter feel, nicely crisp. Enjoyable SIPA.

12 ounce bottle. Smell like a hoppy beer. A nice refreshing beer that is medium straw in color. Taste hoppy and crisp. Medium carbonation. A little astringent and fizzy on the tongue. Average India pale ale.

@ Beeroda.hu Tasting Sessions. Slightly hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, earthy and citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, earthy, little sweet, little grapefruit. Not bad!
Aroma is a little malty. Taste is sweet citrus with a touch of bitter hops. Overall just a little too sweet for me.

355ml Bottle: Pours a clear pale straw with white head that persists. Lacing. Aroma of heavy citrus, pine and some tropical fruits. I get some spiciness coming through on taste as well as citrus and pine from the hops. Not much in the way of bitterness, but the hop aroma and flavour is great. Medium to light bodied, medium carbonation. Overall I enjoy this beer, however, it could still use a little bit more bitterness.

Bottle. Light pale almost clear Amber beer with a touch of haze and a thin white foam head. Nose is light fruity grapefruit rind, pine, lemon,citrus bitters, minerals. Light and fragrant citrus aromas. Taste is crisp and light citrus fruit, grapefruit rind, pine, touch of pineapple, slight grassiness.

Ljus och klar. Fruktig och humlig doft. Smaken är fyllig med humle och en lätt beska

Bottle - pours a straw color with a coarse bubbly white head, fairly unstable. Dank hop aroma, some pine, florals and grain. Crisp and fresh on the tongue, some spiciness on the tongue, well balanced sweet breadiness with the bitterness... Notes of strawberry towards the end. Excellent version of the style!

Copenhagen 22/10 2016. 35,5 cl (12 oz) bottle from Meny. Dog looking kinda sad on the label together with the happy go lucky message "Life is uncertain, don’t sip." 

Pours slightly hazy pale yellow with white head. Settles as patchy thin layer of foam. 

Aroma is intense with sweet exotic fruit like peach, passion fruit and mango. Light overtones of sour grape fruit. 

Medium carbonation and watery texture. 

Flavor has light sweetness and more distinct bitter sourness. 

A bit thin and watery but for a beer that they advertise that you can drink in the work time and "stay in the game" that might be a necessity.
Bottle.Hazy yellow colour with medium off white head.Aroma of lemon and hops mild with low bitterness and hint of bread and citrus,medium body and fruity and malty finish.
Bottle at home. Clear yellow with a white head, nice lacings. Aroma medium malty (bread) and hoppy (citursy). Flavor medium sweet and bitter, citrusy, light spicy. Medium body.

Bottle, bought@Beershoppen, Kolding. Pours clear pale golden with a medium, staying, frothy white head. Aroma has sweet malts, doughy, firm hops. Resin, bergamot, light petroleum. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel, especially for the ABV. Flavour has initial chewy malts, fine bitterness, bergamot aplenty, light citrus. Fine, lingering bitterness. Very drinkable.

Bottled. A yellow beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, hops, straw, and spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, straw, hops, and clean malt, leading to a bitter finish.

Pours Amber from the bottle; producing a white head. Aroma is slightly fruity if given time to develop. Flavor starts bitter, but not unpleasant. This transforms into a fruity maturity. A complex beer that deserves your attention.
